intro: Tamamschjanella cruciata, commonly known as the Armenian crosswort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is often found in alpine environments. Tamamschjanella cruciata is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
